
A careless admin encrypted a secret with RSA using a modulus that's the product of two Blum integers. Recover the flag: 2175754196698939246731674685356122780826678528877250075094211938741696114609537838293887476418899389888603888139070105005383643717436797811182209628077717


The flag format is flag{...}
n=5593925099625213182729110126542644664195062294988564693310462883474579511521276976520648182587239121760656718135904364415871781078222711798879920894053169, e=2850474120369445756689396802435962414550616725370313977494190723774007849787038894612274309764243685264316916312709523482437816773574705240840740697400663
The lower 104 bits of p are: 68878264803952615589586903089752132323


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{10mvrhdr}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2175754196698939246731674685356122780826678528877250075094211938741696114609537838293887476418899389888603888139070105005383643717436797811182209628077717
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5593925099625213182729110126542644664195062294988564693310462883474579511521276976520648182587239121760656718135904364415871781078222711798879920894053169, e=2850474120369445756689396802435962414550616725370313977494190723774007849787038894612274309764243685264316916312709523482437816773574705240840740697400663
The lower 104 bits of p are: 68878264803952615589586903089752132323

extra_info: p=64832297030651446814994083839270726074032439562038890919391735799233010551523, q=86283000230278967134738293738021455946203007610963446656304020702340047178203, Ï†(n)=5593925099625213182729110126542644664195062294988564693310462883474579511521125861223387252173289389383079425953884128968698778740647016042378347836323444
